body: @xuesheng-git please update your report according to issue template https://raw.github.com/owncloud/core/master/issue_template.md
@georgehrke do you have any idea? any db schema changes?

we renamed the database table from oc_calendar_objects to oc_clndr_objects, so it's compatible with oracledb.

@xuesheng-git what db do you use?

strange
i use debian wheezy with mysql and apache 2.2.22 and my upgrade worked just fine
@xuesheng-git do you have any other tables besides owncloud in that particular database?

i've owncloud running in its own guest system. mysql is only used for owncloud (no other databases).
database setup was done according to:
http://doc.owncloud.org/server/5.0/admin_manual/configuration/configuration_database.html

    mysql> show tables;
    +------------------------------+
    | tables_in_owncloud           |
    +------------------------------+
    | oc_appconfig                 |
    | oc_calendar_calendars        |
    | oc_calendar_objects          |
    | oc_calendar_repeat           |
    | oc_calendar_share_calendar   |
    | oc_calendar_share_event      |
    | oc_contacts_addressbooks     |
    | oc_contacts_cards            |
    | oc_contacts_cards_properties |
    | oc_file_map                  |
    | oc_filecache                 |
    | oc_files_trash               |
    | oc_files_trashsize           |
    | oc_files_versions            |
    | oc_gallery_sharing           |
    | oc_group_admin               |
    | oc_group_user                |
    | oc_groups                    |
    | oc_locks                     |
    | oc_lucene_status             |
    | oc_media_albums              |
    | oc_media_artists             |
    | oc_media_sessions            |
    | oc_media_songs               |
    | oc_media_users               |
    | oc_mimetypes                 |
    | oc_permissions               |
    | oc_pictures_images_cache     |
    | oc_preferences               |
    | oc_properties                |
    | oc_queuedtasks               |
    | oc_share                     |
    | oc_storages                  |
    | oc_users                     |
    | oc_vcategory                 |
    | oc_vcategory_to_object       |
    +------------------------------+
    36 rows in set (0.00 sec)

> how to do that?

you have to rename all owncloud calendar tables from oc_calendar_* to oc_clndr_*. afterwords you have to update the  oc_appconfig table and set configvalue to 0.6.4 where appid is calendar and configkey is installed_version

is there anything special in your owncloud.log or apache's error log?

the posted error msg is the only error msg in owncloud.log since last week.
apache error.log also does not contain more errors than usual:

    [wed jul 10 22:30:40 2013] [error] [client 127.0.0.1] client denied by server configuration: /var/www/owncloud/data/htaccesstest.txt
    [wed jul 10 22:30:40 2013] [error] [client 127.0.0.1] file does not exist: /var/www/core
    [wed jul 10 22:41:24 2013] [error] [client 192.168.5.70] file does not exist: /var/www/favicon.ico
    [wed jul 10 22:41:24 2013] [error] [client 192.168.5.70] file does not exist: /var/www/favicon.ico

thanks for providing the necessary database changes. although i'll have to look closer into the mysql documentation because i've no clue how to do these "simple" changes. i wouldn't mind if someone could post copy'n'paste commands.

thanks for all your help! i'll report back as soon as possible.


may one last note: i was also hit by issue 999 and did the following commands to solve upgrade issues from 5.0.5 to 5.0.6 (https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/999#issuecomment-16778131)
any relation to this database issue?

>[wed jul 10 22:30:40 2013] [error] [client 127.0.0.1] client denied by server configuration: /var/www/owncloud/data/htaccesstest.txt
[wed jul 10 22:30:40 2013] [error] [client 127.0.0.1] file does not exist: /var/www/core
[wed jul 10 22:41:24 2013] [error] [client 192.168.5.70] file does not exist: /var/www/favicon.ico
[wed jul 10 22:41:24 2013] [error] [client 192.168.5.70] file does not exist: /var/www/favicon.ico

nothing to worry about. automatic data folder protection works and your host has no favicon.ico in the root directory (it is in core/img/favicon.png)

your initial post shows the error message "multiple primary key defined". i've no clue where this error message comes from. let's see if our db experts have an idea why this error occurred (ping @deepdiver1975 @butonic)

maybe i'm repeating myself and i know nothing about mysql, but issue 999 seems to be also related to "multiple primary key defined". see for example: https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/999#issuecomment-15780942

maybe the cause is the same!?

> maybe i'm repeating myself and i know nothing about mysql, but issue 999 seems to be also related to "multiple primary key defined". see for example: #999

> maybe the cause is the same!?

you are right. it looks like there is most certainly a connection between those two bugs

hi! 

we had the same issue when updating from 5.0.7 to 5.0.8 using sqlite over ubuntu 12.04 64 bits.

the messages were the following:

actualizando owncloud a la versiã³n 5.0.8, esto puede demorar un tiempo.

turned on maintenance mode
updated database
updating filecache, this may take really long...
... 9% done ...
... 18% done ...
... 27% done ...
... 36% done ...
... 45% done ...
... 54% done ...
... 63% done ...
... 72% done ...
... 81% done ...
... 90% done ...
... 100% done ...
updated filecache
failed to update calendar app: failed to update database structure (mdb2_schema error: invalid, it was specified a previous table name ("oc_calendar_repeat") for table "oc_clndr_repeat" that does not exist)

the update was unsuccessful. please report this issue to the owncloud community.

i had to roll back to 5.0.7 with the db file used for the update, so please, if maybe we have problems in that side, tell me about them. it seems to work correctly.

thanks for the efforts.

omar

hi @omarwllorente,
would you mind posting a list of your database tables?

@omarwllorente 
it looks like there is a database table missing in your owncloud instance.

indeed, the table oc_calendar_repeat is missing for some reason.

```
sqlite> .schema oc_clndr_repeat
create table "oc_calendar_repeat" ("id" integer primary key autoincrement, "eventid" integer unsigned default 0 not null, "calid" integer unsigned default 0 not null, "startdate" datetime default '1970-01-01 00:00:00', "enddate" datetime default '1970-01-01 00:00:00');
sqlite>
```
the update should work afterwords
@omarwllorente btw, did you had problems with stucking in maintenance mode with earlier versions of owncloud?

@georgehrke thanks!!

it worked like a charm! only notice that i was unable to see the updating process log. i don't know if the reason is related to the previus updating process to 5.0.8.

about maintenance mode, i'm not aware of how to enter that mode otherwise the updating process... if you want me to test it anyhow, please let me know.

thank you again!

omar

> only notice that i was unable to see the updating process log.

the calendar updates independently after the owncloud core update finished. the updating process log only shows the progress of the core update

> about maintenance mode, i'm not aware of how to enter that mode otherwise the updating process... if you want me to test it anyhow, please let me know.

i mean did you had to set maintenance to false in config.php, to get owncloud work again when updating to previous versions of owncloud?
yes, i think i had to do it once. sorry i don't remember exactly when because we did the upgrade from 4.0.8 to 4.5.12 and then to 5.0.7...

> yes, i think i had to do it once. sorry i don't remember exactly when because we did the upgrade from 4.0.8 to 4.5.12 and then to 5.0.7...

okay, that's most certainly the reason why the database table oc_calendar_repeat was missing

hi there,

i'm having the issues that the calendar app couldnt update. now i did some renaming (from calendar to cldnr) in phpmyadmin. strange thing with my db is that it is missing the oc_calendar_share_calendar table.

should i be worried?

> i'm having the issues that the calendar app couldnt update. now i did some renaming (from calendar to cldnr) in phpmyadmin. strange thing with my db is that it is missing the oc_calendar_share_calendar table.

> should i be worried?

did you had problems with stucking in maintenance mode with earlier versions of owncloud?
i can remember one maybe two times.not sure it was in 4 or 5. however i am able to share calendars...

that's probably the reason why the table was missing.
if you created oc_calendar_share_calendar for now, there should be no problems with future updates.

but shouldnt it be named oc_clndr_share_calendar now? or do you mean, first create then rename to new convention?

oh and perhaps do you have the query for me? my pretty much a noob at this
